intro: Neocalyptrocalyx atlanticus, commonly known as the Atlantic crypton, is a rare and specialized plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring small, clustered leaves with a waxy coating that helps retain moisture in its arid habitat. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are adapted for wind pollination, a common trait in coastal flora. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to anchor firmly in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Neocalyptrocalyx atlanticus is considered a vulnerable species.
